snippet: The president’s meeting with House Republicans served only to reinforce the divisions that have created a cycle of deadline-driven short-term fiscal policy.
abstract: President Obama's meeting with House Republicans underscores deep divisions over fiscal policy as both sides acknowledge a budget compromise is in doubt despite a new push by the White House; Obama makes clear that their fiscal priorities are still far apart after Republicans rolled out a detailed proposal aimed at eliminating the federal deficit through steep cuts and repealing many of the administration's achievements.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: The president’s meeting with House Republicans served only to reinforce the divisions that have created a cycle of deadline-driven short-term fiscal policy.

headline.seo: Obama and House G.O.P. Meet Over Budget, Still Far Apart
headline.main: U.S. Budget Deal in Doubt; Obama’s Trip to Hill Reveals Split
headline.print_headline: Deal On Budget Seems In Doubt
